Description: The ward number of the physical register in which the voter registered. Some Ward Books contain voter entries from multiple wards.
The volume number of the physical register in which the voter registered
The page number on which the voter's entry can be found
The date on which the voter registered
The geographic ward in which the voter registered to vote.
The geographic precinct in which the voter registered to vote
The name of the voter who registered
The street on which the voter resided on April 1 of the year they registered to vote
The street number at which the voter resided on April 1 of the year they registered to vote
The unit number at which the voter resided on April 1 of the year they registered to vote
The age of the voter on the date they registered to vote
The country in which the voter was born. This field uses the country name as it was written on the date the voter registered rather than present-day country name
The state or province in which the voter was born. This field uses the state/province name as it was written on the date the voter registered rather than present-day state/province name
The county in which the voter was born. This field uses the county name as it was written on the date the voter registered rather than present day county name
The town in which the voter was born. This field uses the town name as it was written on the date the voter registered and  not present day county name
The occupation of the voter as stated by the voter on the date they registered to vote.
The company name or address at which the voter works
The court in which the voter was naturalized as a United States citizen. Since women typically received their citizenship through a husband, this field often denotes the voter's marital status.
The date on which the voter was naturalized as a United States citizen
The name of the voter's husband
The country in which the voter's husband was born
The state or province in which the voter's husband was born. This field uses the state/province name as it was written on the date the voter registered rather than present-day state/province name
The county in which the voter's husband was born. This field uses the county name as it was written on the date the voter registered rather than present day county name
The town in which the voter's husband was born. This field uses the town name as it was written on the date the voter registered rather than present day county name
The date on which the voter's husband was naturalized as a United States citizen
The court in which the voter's husband was naturalized as a United States citizen
The name of the voter's father
The country in which the voter's father was born

Fields: Father State or Province of Birth
Description: The state or province in which the voter's father was born. This field uses the state/province name as it was written on the date the voter registered rather than present-day state or province name
The county in which the voter's father was born. This field uses the county name as it was written on the date the voter registered rather than present day county name
The town in which the voter's father was born. This field uses the town name as it was written on the date the voter registered rather than the present day town name
The present residence of the voter. If the voter's residence is the same as their residence on April 1 of the year they registered, this field will read "same"

Notes written by the Election Department worker who registered the voter. This field includes both notes written in the Notes field in the original physical register as well as notes written in the margins of the register
All data was provided verbally by a voter to a city worker who then recorded the data. Some data may be incomplete or incorrect because of an error on the voter or the city worker's part
All data was originally handwritten in a physical register. Data that is partially illegible and may be an incorrect transcription is marked by brackets and question marks.
